data.title: Floods worsen in Narathiwat, 68 schools close amid rising waters
data.description: Heavy continuous rain makes three main rivers break their banks and inundate more than 40,000 families in 13 districts

data.title: Cyber police target avatar accounts for spreading false allegations against PTT executives
data.description: The Cyber Crime Investigation Bureau (CCIB) is focusing on three "avatar accounts" accused of disseminating false information aimed at tarnishing the reputations of PTT executives. Authorities are preparing to press serious charges against those responsible.

data.title: Illegal Chinese-owned salon in Bangkok shut down
data.description: Police raided an illegal full-service beauty salon owned by a Chinese woman in central Bangkok on Thursday and arrested seven female suspects for working without permits.

data.title: Facial recognition for international flight passengers
data.description: Facial recognition services at six major airports will be expanded to include passengers on international flights starting Dec 1, according to Airports of Thailand Plc (AOT).

data.title: Police join multi-agency response to flooding in South Thailand
data.description: National police chief instructs southern police bureaus to mobilise officers to help flood victims as 13 provinces face heavy rains and flash flooding

data.title: Mapping disasters: How one geologist is saving lives in Thailand
data.description: Prof Santi Pailoplee’s MitrEarth website became a lifeline for northern residents inundated by catastrophic flooding this year

data.title: Police bust int’l ring selling fake accounts to online criminals
data.description: Fifteen arrested, hundreds of thousands of SIM cards seized in Operation ‘CIB Crushes the Grey Dragon’

data.title: Malaysia PM says tens of thousands of people in six states hit by flooding
data.description: KUALA LUMPUR: More than 37,000 people have been affected by flooding caused by torrential rain in six Malaysian states this week, Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said on Thursday.

data.title: Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific accused of mishandling cancelled flight in Bangkok
data.description: Hong Kong flag carrier Cathay Pacific is facing a backlash from some stranded travellers after a flight cancellation in Bangkok left more than 200 passengers stuck in the aircraft for five hours, before they were shuttled to a hotel with their passports taken away without explanation.

data.title: Landslides in Indonesia's Sumatra kill at least 27
data.description: JAKARTA — Indonesian rescuers are searching for passengers trapped in a minibus buried in mud after flash floods and landslides hit several locations in North Sumatra province, killing at least 27, an official said on Thursday.

data.title: Rights group says Vietnam's jailing of Khmer monks violated religious freedom
data.description: HANOI — Human rights activists accused Vietnam of infringing freedom of religion after a court handed jail sentences this week to six ethnically Khmer Buddhist monks and three religious activists.

data.title: Checkpoint set up to prevent foreigners from illegal work in Myanmar
data.description: TAK — Police have set up a highway checkpoint aimed at preventing foreigners from being enticed into illicit work in Myanmar near the border.

data.title: Overnight downpours flood parts of Hat Yai
data.description: City centre remains unaffected but homes in outer areas including Kho Hong district have seen flooding

data.title: ONE Championship: Petchtanong warns Nabil ‘don’t underestimate me’ at Fight Night 26
data.description: Petchtanong Petchfergus  insists his three decades of experience will prove the difference against Nabil Anane at  ONE Fight Night 25  next week.

data.title: Spring News wins honorable mention for Outstanding Online Video Clip
data.description: Video looked at the origins of the Israel-Palestine conflict, the history of which can be traced back thousands of years

data.title: Severe flooding continues in South, train services disrupted
data.description: Heavy rain continues to pound all southern provinces along the Gulf of Thailand until Saturday, as many train services have been suspended due to flooded tracks between Pattani and Yala.

data.title: Social Security Fund boosts pension, severance
data.description: Social security  subscribers will receive more  pension  and severance pay once the way this is calculated has been revised as planned, according to the Social Security Board.

data.title: Whoscall Sweeps Nine Awards at AdPeople Awards 2024
data.description: Whoscall, a leading anti-scam application, and its creative partners, SOUR Bangkok and Dentsu Creative Thailand, triumphed at the AdPeople Awards and Symposium 2024, securing nine top awards for their innovative campaigns. The campaigns included the hit single ‘ ตัดสาย’ (Hang Up) and the radio spot ‘เบอร์อัปมงคล’ (Unlucky Number), which combine music, technology, and entertainment to raise scam awareness and drive behavioural change across Thailand.

data.title: People's Party won't join Sondhi rally
data.description: The main opposition  People

data.title: Bar B Q Plaza elevates mascot Bar B GON to ‘Best Friend Brand’
data.description: Business fable marks a strategic pivot towards more narrative-driven marketing approaches

data.title: South warned of heavy rains and floods, cooler in North
data.description: Thirteen Southern provinces warned to brace for heavy downpours and flash flooding as weather deteriorates

data.title: Mill Hill International School Thailand: A Gateway to Boundless Learning Opportunities
data.description: Mill Hill International School Thailand is set to become a beacon of educational excellence in Chiang Mai, offering parents a unique option for their children

data.title: Chinese EVs, economic factors drive vehicle repossession up
data.description: Auction firm sees 8.7% increase in the number of vehicles being repossessed, with many of them pick-ups used by their owners for commercial purposes

data.title: Thailand’s biggest seizure of call scam equipment
data.description: Police conducted multiple raids in the northern province of Chiang Mai and made the country’s biggest seizure of call scam equipment installed by a Thai-Chinese gang.

data.title: Trump’s policy to drive growth of Thai property sector in 2025
data.description: Property consultant confident the expected tariffs on China will push foreign businesses to move their bases to Thailand

data.title: Cambodia identifies path to improved connectivity
data.description: Cambodia is laying the groundwork to become a regional trade hub in Southeast Asia, through strategic infrastructure investments and policy reforms.

data.title: Unclear if NS defaulter Ben Davis will join Thai team for Asean Cup in Singapore
data.description: National service (NS) defaulter Ben Davis has been called up by Thailand for the Asian Mitsubishi Electric Cup, setting up a potential showdown with the Lions and the Singapore authorities.
